page.title: 13LIMERIGG HALLOWE'EN PARTY
page.content: Hallowe'en is on the 31st. October. Children all over Scotland celebrate Hallowe'en. This is when ghosts, witches and spirits are supposed to come out. On that day,we have a party at school. We all dress up in "fancy dress costume" eg. witches, ghosts, cats, skeletons etc. Prizes are given to those best dressed. We dook for apples ie. each child has to get an apple out of a bath filled with water by using only his/her teeth. We also have to bite off a doughnut or treakle scone which is suspended from a string. We then have a Hallowe'en game followed by each child giving a "party piece" ie. a song,joke,dance etc. Next we have a turnip/ pumpkin lantern competition. (The lanterns can be funny or scarey). Before going home, there is a scatter of peanuts.
